title: Quality Assessment
subtitle: Evaluating data completeness and accuracy
content:
Data Quality Assessment

Completeness analysis and integrity validation. Critical phase to identify data issues before processing. Takes Days 6-9 (Phase 3 - Overlapping). Poor data quality is the #1 cause of project delays.

⚡ Parallel Processing Note

Quality Assessment begins on Day 6 while data collection is still in progress, allowing early identification of data issues and faster remediation.

Completeness Analysis

Days 6-9 (Phase 3 - Overlapping)

Key Metrics to Calculate:

  • Total Spend: SUM(Spend Amount)
  • Transaction Count: COUNT(Transaction ID)
  • Unique Suppliers: COUNT DISTINCT(Supplier Name)
  • Data Completeness: (Non-null values / Total values) × 100

Completeness

% of required fields populated

Accuracy

Consistency

Common Quality Issues

Missing Vendor IDs

Impact: Cannot link to master data

Resolution: Match by vendor name, create mapping table

Duplicate Invoices

Impact: Overstated spend

Resolution: Identify using invoice number + vendor + amount

Invalid GL Codes

Impact: Cannot categorize spend

Resolution: Map to valid codes, request updated mapping

Mixed Currencies

Impact: Incorrect totals

Resolution: Convert to base currency using monthly rates

Quality Gate: Do not proceed to cleansing if overall quality score is below 85%. Request corrected data from source systems first.

Python Script for Quality Check

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

def assess_data_quality(df):
    """Assess data quality across multiple dimensions"""
    
    results = {}
    
    # Completeness
    results['completeness'] = {
        col: f"{(1 - df[col].isna().mean()) * 100:.1f}%"
        for col in df.columns
    }
    
    # Duplicates
    results['duplicates'] = len(df[df.duplicated()])
    
    # Basic statistics
    results['row_count'] = len(df)
    results['column_count'] = len(df.columns)
    
    return results

# Load and assess
df = pd.read_excel('vendor_spend.xlsx')
quality_report = assess_data_quality(df)
print(quality_report)
